speaker: Kathy Sinnott,
english:
Kathy Sinnott, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group . – Mr President, when all else was gone and Jack sold the last cow from what had once been his family’s thriving farm, he at least got a handful of beans. In the Hong Kong Ministerial Conference Commissioner Mandelson made significant concessions on European agriculture in exchange for, I suppose, the hope of concessions in non-agricultural market access from the other big economic powers but, as we know, they did not concede much.
In the exchange of agriculture for services, Irish sugar beet farmers have lost their crop, and we have now lost the last of our sugar factories, in Mallow, in my own constituency, which closed just two weeks ago.
Irish farmers are worried that beef and dairy will be sacrificed next, in an effort to get trade concessions in services. Commissioner, when Mr Mandelson trades off the last Irish cow, what do you expect we will get? So far I cannot see that we have obtained very much.
original:
Kathy Sinnott, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group . – Mr President, when all else was gone and Jack sold the last cow from what had once been his family’s thriving farm, he at least got a handful of beans. In the Hong Kong Ministerial Conference Commissioner Mandelson made significant concessions on European agriculture in exchange for, I suppose, the hope of concessions in non-agricultural market access from the other big economic powers but, as we know, they did not concede much.
In the exchange of agriculture for services, Irish sugar beet farmers have lost their crop, and we have now lost the last of our sugar factories, in Mallow, in my own constituency, which closed just two weeks ago.
Irish farmers are worried that beef and dairy will be sacrificed next, in an effort to get trade concessions in services. Commissioner, when Mr Mandelson trades off the last Irish cow, what do you expect we will get? So far I cannot see that we have obtained very much.
agenda_item: WTO Ministerial Conference in Hong Kong (debate)
summary_english:
{
"headline": "Irish Farmers Sacrificed in Failed WTO Trade Negotiations with Little to Show in Return",
"issueSum": "The speaker raises concerns about significant concessions made on European agriculture at the Hong Kong WTO Ministerial Conference, particularly the impact on Irish farmers including the loss of sugar beet farming and closure of sugar factories, with fears that beef and dairy sectors may be next to be sacrificed for hoped-for concessions in services and non-agricultural market access.",
"positionSum": "The speaker is critical of Commissioner Mandelson's approach to the WTO negotiations, viewing the agricultural concessions as a poor trade-off that has harmed Irish farmers while yielding minimal benefits in return. She expresses concern about future sacrifices of Irish agricultural sectors.",
"argSum": "She argues that the concessions were a bad deal by using the analogy of Jack and the beanstalk - suggesting that like Jack trading away the family cow for beans, the EU traded away valuable agricultural sectors for empty promises. She points to concrete losses (sugar beet farming, factory closures) while questioning what tangible benefits were obtained.",
"propSum": "No specific policy proposals are mentioned by the speaker - the speech focuses on criticism of past decisions rather than proposing alternative approaches.",
"quotes": ["when all else was gone and Jack sold the last cow from what had once been his family's thriving farm, he at least got a handful of beans", "Commissioner Mandelson made significant concessions on European agriculture in exchange for, I suppose, the hope of concessions in non-agricultural market access from the other big economic powers but, as we know, they did not concede much", "Commissioner, when Mr Mandelson trades off the last Irish cow, what do you expect we will get? So far I cannot see that we have obtained very much"]
}
